subject: JUnit documentation
msgSnippet: So said  kentlbeck  on  2002-10-02 ... Please look at my JUnit: A Starter Guide at http://www.diasparsoftware.com and let me know whether that would be
messageBody:
So said kentlbeck on 2002-10-02

>Re: MIT course. I sent the instructor of the course a response, and
>never heard anything back. Their complaints about JUnit, and their
>linking of XP and JUnit, don't make sense to me. Of course
>frameworks should come with docs, since I can't sit their with
>everyone who has downloaded JUnit. And it does. Whether they are
>good or not we can certainly debate, but they've been good enough
>for a bunch of folks. If someone wishes they had another doc as a
>beginner, they are certainly welcome to write it and we'll put it in
>the distribution.

Please look at my JUnit: A Starter Guide at
http://www.diasparsoftware.com and let me know whether that would be
suitable to add to the distribution. I have no problem with making it
available.

J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
